definition: something forfeited or subject to being forfeited (as for a crime, offense, or neglect of duty) : penalty
examples: They were required to pay a forfeit.

definition: something deposited (as for making a mistake in a game) and then redeemed on payment of a fine
a game in which forfeits are exacted
to lose or lose the right to especially by some error, offense, or crime
to subject to confiscation as a forfeit, abandon, give up
